page.title: 05CLIFF HATCH STABLES, WOKING
page.content: Cliff Hatch Stables is situated in Saunders Lane in Mayford.They own about sixteen acres but they lease about fourteen acres.The horses are fed on cubes, their old diet consisted of sugar-beet, oats, chaff and barley. They have field and stable liveries. The horses are shod every five weeks. The weekends are the bussiest times at the stables. They own about thirty horses, The favourites are a mare called 'Ferhanoush' and a stallion called 'Arabian Gold'. The only time the horses play up is when it is windy. The owner, is hoping for an indoor riding school but she needs planning permission. The stables have recently been replaced and are in very good condition.
